home.title: Clans of Caledonia Solo Helper
home.play1: Play Clans of Caledonia against Automa, the solo opponent.
home.play2: This application replaces the Automa cards, and guides you through the game flow. Additionally, it automates the tech card drafting and prosperity card selection.

expansions.title: Expansions
expansions.intro: If you own the Industria expansion, you can use all new material with the Automa. The three modules listed here have an effect on the Automa gameplay.
expansions.trainPlayerWarning: The Train module with Automa works only in a 2 player game.

setup.title: Game Board
setup.setupGame: Setup the game as usual for {playerCount} players.
setup.playerBoard: Player board: Automa doesn't need a player. But you can use it to organize the Automa's clan components.
setup.clansSelection: Clans selection: the Automa doesn’t have a Clan. You choose between {clanCount} pairs of Clan tiles and Starting tiles.
setup.farmersMarket2Players: Farmers market: Place 2 Farmers markets in the map modules A & C or B & D.
setup.farmersMarket: Farmers market: Place {playerCount} Farmers markets in {playerCount} different map modules.
setup.farmersMarketWorkerPlacement: When you place your own starting Workers, there must be at least 2 hexes in between your starting Worker and any Farmers market.
setup.farmersMarketWorkerPlacementBot: This does not apply to the Automa starting Workers.

botStartingWorkers.title: Automa starting Workers: The Automa places 4 of its Workers before you deploy your Workers. The Automa places 1 Worker in each map module:
botStartingWorkers.port: Worker {worker} on map module {mapModule}: Nearest to the Port tile.
botStartingWorkers.loch: Worker {worker} on map module {mapModule}: Nearest to the central loch.

tieBreaker.title: Choose a hex in this order of priority:
tieBreaker.port: If nearest to port tile, it prefers the hex that gets it into reach of a Port tile,

setup.turnOrder: Turn order: the Automa is last in round 1. The following rounds are in usual Passing order.

award.title: Award
award.drawCard: Draw one Automa Award card and place it below the 5th Scoring tile.
award.scoringDifferent: The way you score the Awards in the Automa mode is different from how you would normally score them.
award.conditions: The conditions are the same as in the multiplayer Award tiles.
award.scoring: Depending on how much you have of the respective item, you score 4VP, 0VP or even lose 4VP.
